TopicTitle: New plane parts don't attach to radial decouplers?

Articles.Content:
Why don't the new SP+ parts attach to radial decouplers? I want to build a space shuttle and attach it to the side of a rocket, but it can't attach properly.

I played with the config file and still no luck. Is there a way to do this?

Edited October 8, 2014 by Fiddlestyx
they should attach just fine, keep in mind that if you are near a seam (Where you connected 2 tanks) it may not connect.
I think I know what you mean. My suggestion would be to build the shuttle first, then attach the booster, rather than the other way around.
Like this. The belly of the fuselage won't attach to the decoupler, just the side attaches. The cargo bay won't attach at all.

Unfortunately that's where the radial attachment nodes are. Works well for multi-fuselage aircraft but not so much for Space Shuttle-style designs. Gusturbo's workaround of building the shuttle and attaching the booster to it works, though.

You don't want to attach it that way anyway, or your plane will have the decoupler struts sticking out the side.

GusTurbo's got it right. The plane is your payload. Build it first.
Ok, thanks. I get it now. (I'm an idiot)
